info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 3:05PM CDT until March 30 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN LAFAYETTE...SOUTHEASTERN EVANGELINE...NORTHERN ACADIA... AVOYELLES...NORTHWESTERN ST. MARTIN AND ST. LANDRY PARISHES... At 304 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from St. Joseph to near Slocum to near Crowley, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Opelousas, Crowley, Eunice, Scott, Breaux Bridge, Rayne, Carencro, Ville Platte, Church Point, Simmesport, Iota, Krotz Springs, Leonville, Arnaudville, Melville, Moreauville, Palmetto, Bordelonville and Bayou Current. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for central, south central and southwestern Louisiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
